page.title: 02A General Survey.
page.content: The area of our block covers three villages, Petham, Lower Hardres and Upper Hardres. They stand on{chalk country about 5 miles to the south of {CANTERBURY.}The land is used almost exclusively for{farming}of various kinds. Formerly{hop farming}was very important in the Petham area but we have found no hop gardens or working oasts at all in this area now. There are still{fruit crops}grown at Petham and Lower Hardres, mainly apples and pears but these seem of less import- ance than cereals and grassland. There are many areas of woodland, mainly{coppiced deciduous wood. Although we worked with recent Ordin- ance Survey Maps, it was noticeable that many field boundaries no longer existed.It see probably that{hedges}in particular have been removed to facil- itate the use of{farm machinery.
